etymologies: mid 19th century. Apparently an alteration of in bank after French en in and either French banc bench or perhaps English banc, medieval variant of bank

definitions: With all (or a majority or quorum) of the judges of a court present; before or by the full bench.

notes.text: A sitting en banc is typically held by an appeal court in order to review decisions made by a panel of its members. Some courts (e.g. the Supreme Court of the United States) traditionally hear all cases referred to them en banc.

definitions: That is heard, conducted, or arrived at by or with all (or a majority or quorum) of the judges of a court present; (of a court) sitting en banc.
